title: Wrong Error Message for Conv2D with too large Kernel Size
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Wrong Error Message for Conv2D with a too large Kernel Size in Pytorch Version: 1.0.0a0+1c7832c

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

m = nn.Conv2d(in_channels=3, out_channels=33, kernel_size=10, stride=1, bias=True)
input = torch.randn(1, 3, 1, 1)
output = m(input)

it should produce (the official release does that):

Calculated padded input size per channel: (1 x 1). Kernel size: (10 x 10). Kernel size can't be greater than actual input size at
aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialConvolutionMM.c

instead I get:

std::exception

Environment

Pytorch Version: 1.0.0a0+1c7832c

  • OS (e.g., Linux): Linux
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): source
  • Build command you used (if compiling from source): python setup.py build develop
  • Python version: 3.5.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2 / no cuDNN

## 🐛 Bug

Wrong Error Message for Conv2D with a too large Kernel Size in Pytorch Version: 1.0.0a0+1c7832c

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

`m = nn.Conv2d(in_channels=3, out_channels=33, kernel_size=10, stride=1, bias=True)`
`input = torch.randn(1, 3, 1, 1) `
`output = m(input)`

it should produce (the official release does that):

> Calculated padded input size per channel: (1 x 1). Kernel size: (10 x 10). Kernel size can't be greater than actual input size at 
_aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialConvolutionMM.c_

instead I get:

>  std::exception

## Environment

Pytorch Version: 1.0.0a0+1c7832c

 - OS (e.g., Linux): Linux
 - How you installed PyTorch (`conda`, `pip`, source): source
 - Build command you used (if compiling from source): python setup.py build develop
 - Python version: 3.5.6
 - CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2 / no cuDNN
